title-group.article-title: SELECTING POLYNOMIALS FOR THE FUNCTION FIELD SIEVE

abstract.p: The Function Field Sieve algorithm is dedicated to computing discrete logarithms in a finite field ++, where q is a small prime power. The scope of this article is to select good polynomials for this algorithm by defining and measuring the size property and the so-called root and cancellation properties. In particular we present an algorithm for rapidly testing a large set of polynomials. Our study also explains the behaviour of inseparable polynomials, in particular we give an easy way to see that the algorithm encompass the Coppersmith algorithm as a particular case.
